alert.note: Alert for Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:22AM EST until February 19 at 4:35AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station affecting Trumbull County. For the Site Specific Non-forecast Pt...including Phalanx Station... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Eagle Creek At Phalanx Station. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding begins on Braceville Robinson Road. Portions of Barcley Messerly Road south of Eagle Creek Road will be impassable. Some homes will be threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 13.2 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 03/01/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 930 PM EST.
